title: Scientific Thinking and Technology – Exploring, Scientific Inquiry, and Discovery
subject: Learning Standards for Early Childhood (2024-)

document.title: Pennsylvania Learning Standards for Early Childhood PRE-KINDERGARTEN

0550BA9BA29E44A78E2B42133FCD79F5.description: Locate information on identified topics using media (e .g ., music, books, maps, TV programming, newspapers, magazines, movies, Internet, applications, advertising)

DC90BA36FBFA4793A67F0080D79BFC60.description: Label types of media and what information can be gained (e .g ., recipes from a cookbook, prices from an advertisement) .

1BE5F8F677774E999CF9F833E4F69789.description: Understand that information comes from many sources such as books, computers, and newspapers.

F6D73562E7F546BCAB2DF9976A0A6E82.description: Use words to describe time (e .g ., yesterday, today, tomorrow, o’clock) .

6984CCDF2A374203916FDBE4DC368BF0.description: Show anticipation for regularly- scheduled events .

DAC49B6B24F94D39BD5B5C878A30BBE6.description: Describe the daily routine (e .g ., what happens first, before lunch, after lunch, at end of day) .

924F213A4D44481B946C99D75BEC3684.description: Demonstrate an understanding of past, present, and future (e .g ., today is   , yesterday was   , and tomorrow will be   , recall information from the immediate past, sequence pictures of self from birth to present) .

221C98675F2B4D85934AD5F21B2BFC73.description: Identify a sequence of events through a day.

494A6700B87D473E80E985C489679215.description: Describe simple characteristics of business or community structures (e .g ., type of dwelling, where located, what surrounds it) .

7CF4EBF6A5BC45A0A83293523D9E0F3C.description: Identify familiar places in the neighborhood .

261AFB8B5C544155921A5C63E76A3DF2.description: Describe simple characteristics of home (e .g ., type of dwelling, where located, what surrounds it) .

C02253803F634804ADB64CD47BFB02D5.description:
Describe the characteristics of home and
frequently visited locations to gain an understanding of physical features.

A87F871C4EC3410BA3BDEAE9B09DDD55.description: PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF PLACES AND REGIONS

33757BBC3FE84D22AC4C646D835C01AA.description: Listen to directions and retrieve items .

5484EA30186D48FF8201CAA08C2687FA.description: Place pictures of common household items in the proper rooms of a floor plan .

EC012799563942AAB5DF19B8055B8EAB.description: Use directionality, size, and position (e .g ., left, right, first, last, little, big, top, bottom) to describe location .

62528D11834D467891DA8F7485D71004.description: Describe the location of items/areas in the classroom and at home .

F697A87F16644E8784122AE2DE6F3F86.description:
Describe the location of places in the home, school, and community to gain an
understanding of relative location.

2FF8DC2ECA274016849A125D6984B833.description: Discuss tools used to locate places .

533C46EBD4B64D0584FD3E61245B9BFC.description: Include representations of roads, bodies of water, and buildings in play .

27B0F235A2134895AFBD34D2665AE2FC.description: Use available materials (e .g ., blocks) to represent buildings, roads, or houses .

1C512E00927941B98936F4BE37F5D114.description:
Explain how a map is a
representation of places.

E4265BBBE4C5427D8775F4A1106D4AA2.description: Describe where customers go to acquire specific goods or services (e .g ., food purchased at grocery store, hammer and nails purchased at hardware store) .

FC7D8105FCD7490E9DC918E5577E939A.description: Participate in role-play that is related to a local business (e .g ., pet store, hair salon, restaurant) .

706CFB49C76A4B21AB74507FD29E39E0.description: Relate that play is a self-selected activity that may or may not have a specific purpose .

638CBEC905EB43A88C2FA5C06BC4F0DB.description: Relate that work involves performing an activity that is chosen and directed by someone else, and has a specific goal .

6084F3103EF643008F53C15C2BC4749E.description: Respond that adults work to earn money .

9ECADBDBA9FA4B899A9ABA83355B7983.description: Talk about products that can be found around their homes .

4EEAD680B89246469CA4697A17D640EC.description: Name items that come from farms, factories, and/or businesses within the community .

03954274360B44EC8DC534665093428C.description: Practice exchanging play money for goods .

1DCA345C835144769DB06E10188D4619.description: Use pretend money while engaging in dramatic play activities .

59F436189EDA43A295C764A2DDD01B44.description: State that money can be saved .

6C9554BE17594D41B249CA406CDD2638.description: Identify that money is used to buy things .

EFFDF5B752794441A4FF897310AD03DB.description: Recognize logos (environmental print) from local businesses .

EA2A0BEAAE1E4219961A656790A8D6F6.description: Identify advertisements that encourage us to buy things.

D96DC94C242B45C48DEE6BD484327014.description: Provide a reason for choosing to play in a particular center that shows interest in specific materials or people .

50AE1A9E11144540859A2F2FF1D1FB61.description: Make a choice and explain the reason for the choice .

2BF995ED284D4B928D3AA52589F08D92.description: Identify a choice based on individual interest.

A4B252E6230D4517B30453E162D35DC8.description: Demonstrates awareness of one’s own preferences .

37247A5CE54C4CA3B0DC85BCF0517C55.description: Identify what people need to survive .

DACF3573D2834358B5BE926D713C77F6.description: Show preference for one material/center, but choose a different material/center when materials are scarce or center is full

C2A9817AFBBD459CAF646726C9385A20.description: Offer to share materials when materials are scarce (e .g ., one shovel in sensory table) .

AFC3CCABBB7C47F5B1D08F53366458E1.description: Notice when materials are running low (e .g ., “We need more paper in the art area .”) .

507D3373CC134098868846C845572357.description: Understand that some resources are limited .

F7256DDDDDEE4DF5872C8D4A26328383.description: Respect another’s attempts to complete tasks independently .

43BDB95FD9C64A19AA9A63924E721124.description: Recognize when someone needs help and offer assistance .

69DB9B6F8CE94DD3840E50E1CDD9D767.description: Respond with empathy to others who are upset .

56E1F4B908BB47099B5A577F43FF95B0.description: Follow rules and routines in classroom .

C7183C657D4E4D4DBADB24214897F3DD.description: Cooperate in both large and small group activities that are facilitated by adult .

9B1EEC34083B4C8685642D73826A94C0.description: Use inside voices while indoors and outside voices when outdoors .

DA8186A76DA24F29965C91874D17B556.description: Identify appropriate behaviors for responsible classroom citizens.

81374225748D4AAF81205211E6888E02.description: Relay personal experiences to describe the work that community workers do .

630724776F6C4FB1A4DF9C893B01CC24.description: Act out roles of community workers in dramatic play .

78214B7A11DD4341A7ECBB49CE2ED73F.description: Match descriptions of people’s work in a community with picture illustrating the job .

8A906FB8E8DC4E26AC1C088C092513C5.description: Identify community workers through their uniforms and equipment.

322BD0364C924A558ED76F141607B202.description: Ask to be the line leader .

6BAEB94D30B44B7A802648EE12DDE24D.description: Choose a leader for a classroom project .

9941E61CC8714F80B010BDA06ED3DB1F.description: Identify classroom projects/activities that support leadership and service.

E9DA251D2FFE43F39EB8384600E2B3C0.description: Suggest simple solutions to conflict which are most often based upon own needs and desires .

6F033965E000438CAA7D07C2DFC60F50.description: Work with a peer to develop a solution to a problem (e .g ., ways to share the playdough when there isn’t enough) .

C56B8222F1E34A1C85966543FC2F2B18.description: Attempt to solve a conflict with a peer .

5926168FC68D46499C328BECDA016260.description: Identify one or two solutions to a problem .

CA4253C619D346BE86DE4A9A3AD9704C.description:
Identify a problem and discuss possible solutions with adult assistance.
*See also 16.2 PK.D

0106451669914D76AAC6419B912A5EC2.description: Work cooperatively with other children to achieve an outcome .

F0F861E02C2E427297D764D84D5E05FD.description: Participate in classroom and family responsibilities .

CCD55EF537F64929BACA3DC0DCF5F81F.description: Display awareness of role as member of a group .

44AD09F4CBE04B2C900C7EB5B74E22B6.description: Identify self- membership of a group such as the class or family.

8177A174704F45998685C06749CC043D.description: Replicate the American flag using art materials .

2273A4EB930C46EBA25BB8927ABAACE5.description: Discuss images, pictures or items that are symbols of America .

C548E693B2DC42E398C6D0D6E3BF0E86.description: Identify basic American symbols. (e.g., American flag)

8D881C32A67F4334B3A56109A6C2FDA0.description: Explain a consequence for breaking a classroom rule .
